com.github.thorbenkuck.netcom2.network.interfaces

Interface NetworkInterface

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Launch, Loggable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ClientStart, ServerStart

    public interface NetworkInterface
extends Launch, Loggable
    This Interface is used, to show that something is the entry point for a Network Communication.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    See Also:
    ClientStart, ServerStart

    • Method Detail

      • setConnectionFactory

        void setConnectionFactory(ConnectionFactory connectionFactory)
        Sets the ConnectionFactory, that should be used internally.

        Null is not a valid parameter. This method will throw an IllegalArgumentException, if null is provided, since this ConnectionFactory is one of the heart peaces of NetCom2

        Parameters:
        connectionFactory - the ConnectionFactory
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the connectionFactory is null.

      • cache

        Cache cache()
        Provides the internal cache of the ClientStart.

        The Cache is used, to hold registered Objects and may be updated manually. Also, you may add manual observers.

        Returns:
        an instance of the Cache
        See Also:
        Sender

      • getCommunicationRegistration

        CommunicationRegistration getCommunicationRegistration()
        Returns the internally maintained CommunicationRegistration.

        This CommunicationRegistration will never be null. It cannot change the instance ever.

        This means, it is not necessary to maintain any CommunicationRegistration instance anywhere else. You may change the CommunicationRegistration of course based on the methods provided by the interface, since the CommunicationRegistration is not immutable.

        In fact, this method is the main point for defining communication protocols.

        Returns:
        the internally maintained CommunicationRegistration.
        See Also:
        CommunicationRegistration
